CodeList.Name: Microbiology Susceptibility Test Code

Description.TranslatedText: Terminology relevant to the test codes that define microorganism responses to antimicrobial agents.

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: A fold change based on a concentration of a specific drug expected to produce 50 percent inhibition of the standard growth of a microbial organism, or of a biological/biochemical reaction. It is a ratio calculated by the current IC50 Subject Result divided by the IC50 Subject Result from the baseline visit.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Half Maximal Inhibitory Concentration Fold Change from Baseline Measurement

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: A fold change based on a concentration of a specific drug expected to produce 50 percent inhibition of the standard growth of a microbial organism, or of a biological/biochemical reaction. It is a ratio calculated by the IC50 Subject Result divided by the IC50 Reference Control Result.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Half Maximal Inhibitory Concentration Fold Change from Reference Measurement

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: A reference control sample response based on a concentration of a specific drug expected to produce 50 percent inhibition of the standard growth of a microbial organism, or of a biological/biochemical reaction.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Half Maximal Inhibitory Concentration Reference Control Result Measurement

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: A measurement of titer of a microbial organism or biological/biochemical reaction that has been exposed to a concentration of a specific drug expected to produce 50 percent inhibition of the standard growth of the microbial organism, or of a reaction.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: Half Maximal Inhibitory Concentration Subject Result Measurement

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: A fold change based on a concentration of a specific drug expected to produce 95 percent inhibition of the standard growth of a microbial organism, or of a biological/biochemical reaction. It is a ratio calculated by the current IC95 Subject Result divided by the IC95 Subject Result from the baseline visit.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: 95 Percent Maximal Inhibitory Concentration Fold Change from Baseline Measurement

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: A fold change based on a concentration of a specific drug expected to produce 95 percent inhibition of the standard growth of a microbial organism, or of a biological/biochemical reaction. It is a ratio calculated by the IC95 Subject Result divided by the IC95 Reference Control Result.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: 95 Percent Maximal Inhibitory Concentration Fold Change from Reference Measurement

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: A reference control sample response based on a concentration of a specific drug expected to produce 95 percent inhibition of the standard growth of a microbial organism, or of a biological/biochemical reaction.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: 95 Percent Maximal Inhibitory Concentration Reference Control Result Measurement

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: A measurement of titer of a microbial organism or biological/biochemical reaction that has been exposed to a concentration of a specific drug expected to produce 95 percent inhibition of the standard growth of the microbial organism, or of a reaction.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: 95 Percent Maximal Inhibitory Concentration Subject Result Measurement

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: An indication of reduced or increased susceptibility of a microbial organism, or activity of a biological/biochemical reaction in response to the inhibitory concentration (IC50 and/or IC95) of a specific drug.
A measurement that specifies the minimum concentration of the agent at which organism growth was inhibited.
A measurement of the response of the microbial organism to a controlled concentration of an antimicrobial agent.

CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: CDISC SDTM Microbiology Susceptibility Test Code Terminology
